@Tyne_Wear_FRS @suezUK @gateshead @SunderlandUK @EnvAgencyYNE @northumbriapol @nwater_care @NEAS_HART It's great that the people of Gateshead are optimally fluoridated and with this fire even more optimally. https://t.co/Zpe9jl4i01
https://t.co/gV2tcewaBY https://t.co/atKzsBHXsL

@ChronicleLive Fluorocarbons out-newsed by cyanide. CFCs kept vague. Keep bad fluoride out of the press: people will confuse bad fluorides and miracle fluoride that @nwater_care had to disperse into these fridge-burners, despite them likely being over the safe limit, 0.05-0.07mg/kgBW/day ok? https://t.co/aKqNQlPDvY

Crews are currently dealing with a large #wastefire  in Gateshead. This is a deep seated fire and crews will be on scene for a protracted period of time. This is a multi agency response and we ask residents to stay away from the area. Keep windows and doors closed. https://t.co/GRipnNloT3

The @EnvAgency need to understand that groundwater ingress is an un-permitted reason to discharge untreated sewage. We hope the local residents impacted by these discharges are compensated for having to live with these daily events, has happened continuously since the 22nd Jan.

@MaryDuffinator @welshharpies @EnvAgency @barnetvolunteer @Thames21 @silkstreamers @ben_watt @Heybournepark @woodcockpark @Natures_Voice @WildLondon @volunteering_uk Hi Mary, birding season is nearly upon us and we have a legal requirement to refill the reservoir by this time. But we plan to continue to work with all the relevant agencies to look after this area, more information here: https://t.co/FA2tVJ6BCc

urls.title: The Welsh Harp Reservoir Clean-Up | Canal & River Trust
urls.description: The Canal and River Trust have looked after the Welsh Harp since it became a charity in 2012, and before that as British Waterways. We are working with our partners in the area to find an efficient and safe solution for the unsightly rubbish on the reservoir bed.

tweets.text: @welshharpies @EnvAgency @barnetvolunteer @Thames21 @silkstreamers @ben_watt @Heybournepark @woodcockpark @Natures_Voice @WildLondon @volunteering_uk We have taken some action recently, not as much as we would like due to restrictions though.
